body:
I installed the spack in frontend node of our cluster system.
And I submitted a job via a job scheduler (PBS) to the cluster system.
The content of the job script file is following:

```console
SPACK_ROOT=/work/XMP/mnakao/work/spack
. ${SPACK_ROOT}/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack -d --stacktrace load gcc
```
Of cause, above commands can execute successfully on the frontend node.
But, when executing on a compute node, an error message is output as following:

```console
0/XMP/mnakao/work/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py:683 ==> [2019-05-16-15:08:54.515478] Reading config file /work/0/XMP/mnakao/work/spack/etc/spack/defaults/modules.yaml

0/XMP/mnakao/work/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lock.py:334 ==> [2019-05-16-15:08:54.567201] READ LOCK: /work/0/XMP/mnakao/work/spack/opt/spack/.spack-db/lock[0:0] [Acquired]
```

While OS of the frontend node is Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.6 (Maipo),
OS of the compute node is CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core).

If the OS difference is the cause of the error, how should I install the package on the front node?
title: Cannot load packages
